DOC.brief_title: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) Transmission by Frozen Breast Milk in Preterms
DOC.detailed_description: Preterm infants are at risk of symptomatic human cytomegalovirus infections transmitted by breast milk. This study evaluates incidence, timing, and clinical rlevance of acquired human CMV infections in preterm infants younger than 32 weeks of gestational age receiving maternal thawed frozen breast milk until 33 completed weeks of gestational age.
